newsitem.title: INDIA: India government to unveil budget on Feb 28.
newsitem.headline: India government to unveil budget on Feb 28.

text.p: Indian Finance Minister P. Chidambaram will present the 1997/98 (April-March) federal budget on February 28, a senior finance ministry official said on Sunday.
"The budget will be presented on February 28 at 5 p.m. (1130 GMT)," said the official, who asked not to be identified.
India's parliament is expected to convene on February 20. This will be the second budget presented by Prime Minister H.D. Deve Gowda's United Front coalition.

The railway budget, a separate document that maps the finances of India's vast rail network, is likely to presented on February 24 while the pre-budget economy survey, which is an annual report card on the economy, is likely to be tabled a couple of days ahead of the budget, officials said.
